alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Noble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 27 at 11:45PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central Ohio, including the following counties, Monroe and Noble. * WHEN...Until 300 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1145 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Caldwell, Dudley, Summerfield, Belle Valley, Sarahsville, Dexter City, Harriettsville and Wolf Run State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
